intro: Alsine granuliflora, commonly known as the granular alsike, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many species with showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Its small, pink or white flowers bloom in clusters, and the leaves are narrow and hairy. It is a low-growing plant that can spread by seeds and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
